titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1601c
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1601c

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[šhr | ġyln | bn | ʾbšbm | mlk | qtbn | whb | w-sqny | l-ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-ʾrby-s | ṣḥf | tḥ=] 2.[rg | šʿbn | kḥd | ḏ-dtnt | b-ʿm | kbrm | b-ykbr | w-ḥrg | šʿbn | kḥd | w-l | yṣḥf | w-ḥrg | ḏn] 3.[ṣḥfn | ʿṣmm | b-yʿṣm | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | ṭd | ʾnsm | ḫrfmyw | bn-km | b-ynfṯ | ʿd-km | b-ysfd | ḫrf=] 4.[myw | w-ṯwb | ʾḫ-s | l-ḏn | tḥrgn | l-ḏm | b-yfṯ-s | w-l | yqny | w-ṯʿd | ḏm | b-yḥrg | ḏn | ṣḥf=] 5.[n | b-ʿm | kbrm | b-yḥrg | kḥd | ʿšr | kl | hnʾm | w-mwblm | w-tqntm | w-trṯm | w-kl | lfym | b-y=] 6.[lfy | kbr | kḥd | ḏ-dtnt | w-l | yṣḥf | w-ḥrg | ʿṣmn | bn | šhr | wrḫn | ḏ-tmnʿ | ḫrf | mwhbm | ḏ-ḏ=] 7.[rḥn | ʾḫrn | l-ʾḫr | w-kwn | ḏn | ṣḥfn | sqnytm | l-ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-ʾrby-s | l-ḏt | bd | mlʾt] 8.[w-kwmw | l-yṣḥf | w-ḥrg | w-ʿtqb | w-ṯtwb | ḏn | ṣḥfn | ʾrbym | b-yrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-ṣry] 9.[šhr | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | ʿṣm | ḏ-lbḫ | bn | tḥt | ʿm | ḏ-dwnm | w-ʾnby | šymn | w-šms | w-rbʿ] 10.[šhr | b-ṣdq-sm | ḥg | ḏt | ṣḥftn | w-ʾsṭr-s | w-ṯfṭ | šhr | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | l-ftḫ] 11.[w-sṭr | ḏtn | ʾsṭrn | b-byt | wrfw | w-ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | b-ḏ-ġylm | w-b | byt | ʿm | b-srn | lbḫ] 12.[wrḫ-s | ḏ-brm | qdmn | ḫrf | mwhbm | ḏ-ḏrḥn | qdmn | w-tʿlm-ʾy | yd | šhr] 13.[w-nbṭʿm | bn | ʾlsmʿ | bn | hybr |] 14.[tqdm | ḏtn | ʾsṭrn]

šhr ġyln bn ʾbšbm mlk qtbn whb w-sqny l-ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-ʾrby-s ṣḥf tḥ=
rg šʿbn kḥd ḏ-dtnt b-ʿm kbrm b-ykbr w-ḥrg šʿbn kḥd w-l yṣḥf w-ḥrg ḏn
ṣḥfn ʿṣmm b-yʿṣm ʿm ḏ-lbḫ ṭd ʾnsm ḫrfmyw bn-km b-ynfṯ ʿd-km b-ysfd ḫrf=

w-kwmw l-yṣḥf w-ḥrg w-ʿtqb w-ṯtwb ḏn ṣḥfn ʾrbym b-yrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-ṣry

Text preserved in this squeeze:
......................................
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshibām, King of Qatabān, has offered and dedicated to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests a document (with which) to ad-] 2.[minister the tribe of Kaḥid Dhū-Datīnat, together with any magistrate acting in his capacity as a magistrate and administering the tribe of Kaḥid. And may this document be written and enable administration] 3.[as a directive which ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh has made binding on one man per two years, from (the time) when he is appointed until (the time) when he completes the] 4.[two years and hands his fellow over to this office, to the one who shall appoint him. And may he take ownership of and possess whatever this document commands,] 5.[together with any magistrate who administers Kaḥid, (from) the tithe on all of the profits and revenues and acquisitions and inheritances, and all income which] 6.[the magistrate of Kaḥid of Datīnat might accrue. And may this directive from Shahr be written and take administrative effect in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dha-] 7.[raḥān the Latter, (remaining effective) thenceforth, and may this document be a dedication to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests for all time.] 8.[And therefore, let every priest who serves as priest for ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh write and carry out and administer and adhere to this document. And Shahr announced] 9.[for the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh a directive of Labakh on the authority of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and ʾAnbay the patron god and Shamas and the protector of] 10.]Shahr, with their goodwill, according to this document and its inscriptions. And Shahr directed the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh to engrave] 11.[and inscribe these inscriptions in the temple of Warafū and ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim, and in the temple of ʿAmm in the valley of Labakh.] 12.[(This in) the first month of Dhū-Barīm in the first year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dharaḥān. And Shahr signed (this document) with his own hand,] 13.[and Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ bin Haybar] 14.[directed (the carving of) these inscriptions.]

Restored full text of the inscription:
<lb n="1"/><supplied reason="lost">Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshibām, King of Qatabān, has offered and dedicated to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests a document <unclear>with which</unclear> to ad-</supplied> <lb n="2"/><supplied reason="lost">minister the tribe of Kaḥid Dhū-Datīnat, together with any magistrate acting in his capacity as a magistrate and administering the tribe of Kaḥid. And may this document be written and enable administration</supplied> <lb n="3"/><supplied reason="lost">as a directive which ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh has made binding on one man per two years, from <unclear>the time</unclear> when he is appointed until <unclear>the time</unclear> when he completes the</supplied> <lb n="4"/><supplied reason="lost">two years and hands his fellow over to this office, to the one who shall appoint him. And may he take ownership of and possess whatever this document commands,</supplied> <lb n="5"/><supplied reason="lost">together with any magistrate who administers Kaḥid, <unclear>from</unclear> the tithe on all of the profits and revenues and acquisitions and inheritances, and all income which</supplied> <lb n="6"/><supplied reason="lost">the magistrate of Kaḥid of Datīnat might accrue. And may this directive from Shahr be written and take administrative effect in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dha-</supplied> <lb n="7"/><supplied reason="lost">raḥān the Latter, <unclear>remaining effective</unclear> thenceforth, and may this document be a dedication to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests for all time.</supplied> <lb n="8"/><supplied reason="lost">And therefore, let every priest who serves as priest for ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh write and carry out and administer and adhere to this document. And Shahr announced</supplied> <lb n="9"/><supplied reason="lost">for the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh a directive of Labakh on the authority of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and ʾAnbay the patron god and Shamas and the protector of</supplied> <lb n="10"/></supplied>Shahr, with their goodwill, according to this document and its inscriptions. And Shahr directed the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh to engrave</supplied> <lb n="11"/><supplied reason="lost">and inscribe these inscriptions in the temple of Warafū and ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim, and in the temple of ʿAmm in the valley of Labakh.</supplied> <lb n="12"/><supplied reason="lost"><unclear>This in</unclear> the first month of Dhū-Barīm in the first year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dharaḥān. And Shahr signed <unclear>this document</unclear> with his own hand,</supplied> <lb n="13"/><supplied reason="lost">and Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ bin Haybar</supplied> <lb n="14"/><supplied reason="lost">directed <unclear>the carving of</unclear> these inscriptions.</supplied></ab>

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
......................................
Restored full text of the inscription:
Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshibām, King of Qatabān, has offered and dedicated to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests a document with which to ad-
minister the tribe of Kaḥid Dhū-Datīnat, together with any magistrate acting in his capacity as a magistrate and administering the tribe of Kaḥid. And may this document be written and enable administration
as a directive which ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh has made binding on one man per two years, from the time when he is appointed until the time when he completes the
two years and hands his fellow over to this office, to the one who shall appoint him. And may he take ownership of and possess whatever this document commands,
together with any magistrate who administers Kaḥid, from the tithe on all of the profits and revenues and acquisitions and inheritances, and all income which
the magistrate of Kaḥid of Datīnat might accrue. And may this directive from Shahr be written and take administrative effect in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dha-
raḥān the Latter, remaining effective thenceforth, and may this document be a dedication to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests for all time.
And therefore, let every priest who serves as priest for ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh write and carry out and administer and adhere to this document. And Shahr announced
for the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh a directive of Labakh on the authority of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and ʾAnbay the patron god and Shamas and the protector of
Shahr, with their goodwill, according to this document and its inscriptions. And Shahr directed the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh to engrave
and inscribe these inscriptions in the temple of Warafū and ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim, and in the temple of ʿAmm in the valley of Labakh.
This in the first month of Dhū-Barīm in the first year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dharaḥān. And Shahr signed this document with his own hand,
and Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ bin Haybar
directed the carving of these inscriptions.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
......................................
Restored full text of the inscription:
Shahr Ghaylān bin ʾAbīshibām, King of Qatabān, has offered and dedicated to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests a document with which to ad-
minister the tribe of Kaḥid Dhū-Datīnat, together with any magistrate acting in his capacity as a magistrate and administering the tribe of Kaḥid. And may this document be written and enable administration
as a directive which ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh has made binding on one man per two years, from the time when he is appointed until the time when he completes the
two years and hands his fellow over to this office, to the one who shall appoint him. And may he take ownership of and possess whatever this document commands,
together with any magistrate who administers Kaḥid, from the tithe on all of the profits and revenues and acquisitions and inheritances, and all income which
the magistrate of Kaḥid of Datīnat might accrue. And may this directive from Shahr be written and take administrative effect in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dha-
raḥān the Latter, remaining effective thenceforth, and may this document be a dedication to ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests for all time.
And therefore, let every priest who serves as priest for ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh write and carry out and administer and adhere to this document. And Shahr announced
for the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh a directive of Labakh on the authority of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and ʾAnbay the patron god and Shamas and the protector of
Shahr, with their goodwill, according to this document and its inscriptions. And Shahr directed the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh to engrave
and inscribe these inscriptions in the temple of Warafū and ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim, and in the temple of ʿAmm in the valley of Labakh.
This in the first month of Dhū-Barīm in the first year of Mawhabum Dhū-Dharaḥān. And Shahr signed this document with his own hand,
and Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ bin Haybar
directed the carving of these inscriptions.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
